headline: McCormick (MKC) Stock Trades Up, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of food flavoring company McCormick (NYSE:MKC) jumped 5.6% in the afternoon session after the company reported second-quarter 2025 earnings that beat analyst expectations and reaffirmed its full-year financial outlook. The company posted an adjusted earnings per share of $0.69, surpassing the consensus estimate of $0.65.

headline: McCormick Stock Is Climbing. Spice Maker’s Earnings Beat Expectations.
summary: Shares of  McCormick & Company  were rising Thursday after the spices and seasonings maker posted quarterly earnings that were good enough for Wall Street’s taste.  The company reported adjusted earnings of 69 cents a share on net sales of $1.66 billion for its fiscal second quarter, narrowly above analysts’ consensus forecasts of 65 cents a share and sales of $1.658 billion.  McCormick  also reiterated its fiscal-year forecasts, which called for modest growth across key financial metrics.

raw.headline: McCormick Stock Is Climbing. Spice Maker’s Earnings Beat Expectations.
raw.summary: Shares of  McCormick & Company  were rising Thursday after the spices and seasonings maker posted quarterly earnings that were good enough for Wall Street’s taste.  The company reported adjusted earnings of 69 cents a share on net sales of $1.66 billion for its fiscal second quarter, narrowly above analysts’ consensus forecasts of 65 cents a share and sales of $1.658 billion.  McCormick  also reiterated its fiscal-year forecasts, which called for modest growth across key financial metrics.

headline: McCormick’s (NYSE:MKC) Q2 Earnings Results: Revenue In Line With Expectations
summary: Food flavoring company McCormick (NYSE:MKC) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, but sales were flat year on year at $1.66 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.69 per share was 5.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
